content.1: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.
content.3: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by
content.4: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.
content.5: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.
content.6: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.
content.7: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.
content.8: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.
content.9: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and
content.10: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also
content.11: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.
content.13: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
content.14: Let all your things be done with charity.
content.15: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and
content.16: That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with
content.17: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.
content.18: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.
content.19: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
content.20: All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.
content.22: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.
